description: This large marble room is unlit by the numerous torches in the hall.
It is obviously meant to be a compartment for the guards to stand
in, impeding movement farther down the hall. The only thing unusual about
the room is its size, large enough to hold several guards, or something
larger.
18206.name: In a Huge Side Chamber

description: Within this small alcove, no light from the outside dome can be
seen.. As if the darkness wards out the light. No candles make this
their home, either. Aside from the darkness, this area is somewhat
peaceful, sealed away from the burning flames and ominous presence of
the dark black liquid that threatens even from the deep hole in which
it lays. The two ways out leading back into the dome are north and
west.. Both along a rocky ledge.
18246.name: Dome Alcove

description: The marble corridor gives way to a gigantic stone chamber here, from
inside light spills out into the tunnel and many things inside the chamber
are plainly visible.
18210.name: The Entrance to a Gigantic Chamber

description: Two torches are set into the wall here:  one on the eastern side and
one on the western side, providing a small amount of light. Upwards,
more torches can be seen, lighting the way up, revealing the top of
the shaft. Downwards, however, is still a plummet into absolute
darkness.
18297.name: Steep Shaft

description: The marble corridor continues, the walls glowing with a sheen seen
only on the purest marble polished to perfection. There are no marks
of any kind on these walls, scratches or otherwise. You can see
heat patterns on the cool marble from the rising temperature.
18207.name: Further Along the Marble Corridor

description: Here, the ledge protrudes so far out into the black lake, that it'd
be possible to see the other side of the cavern.. For one with good
eyes. In this particular spot.. The apparent widest, most extended
of the entire ledge.. The ringing candles blanket the wall in a full
sheet of green flames. Not part of the wall can be seen, as the
flames seem to combine into a a full body of bright green fire.
18244.name: Dome Ledge

description: A huge cave looms ahead, emitting a faint glow. Red light from torches
illuminates the entrance to the cave, and you see deep claw markes in the
solid stone walls. The ground seems charred and burned.
18200.name: At the Entrance to a Cave

description: The cavern makes a turn here, to the south and the east, rounded by
the caverns flawless circular structure and impeccably smooth walls.
These features compliment the turn, making almost elegant.. Perhaps
if it were in some king's fast hallway. One could only wonder at how
something such as this could have been created.
18272.name: Dark Cavern

description: The ledge you are now on is more of a dozen foot-long projection
from the side of the giant dome's wall. Foothold here is more than
steady, so the ominous drop to one side doesn't present much of a
problem, presently. Red candles line the wall on one side, reaching
far above your head to the dome's ceiling. They are set in an
amazingly accurate array, pushed into the wall itself at even
intervals, giving the appearance a somewhat spiral effect all around.
Not all of them are lit however.. Some random candles have been
extinguished, when others are darkened in packs, leaving black spots
on the walls amongst the other lighted candles. The ones that do
burn.. Leave no waxy residue at all.  There's no telling how long
they may have been burning.
18251.name: Dome Ledge

description: A huge marble room glows brightly from the torches. This room appears
to be a normal guard room except for the fact that it is huge.
There are huge recesses in the marble on the east and west sides,
and the torches are positione as to prevent any light from penetrating.
18205.name: Huge Marble Guard Room

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18264.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: Following alongside the Dome's walls, this ledge only gives a dozen
feet of room for error before ending in a vertical drop-off into a
black abyss of liquid. Masterfully set in a spiral shaped design are
thousands of candles jutting directly out of the dome's walls,
lighting the place. Though not all the candles are lit, leaving a few
dark spots here and there.
18240.name: Dome Ledge

description: Candles flicker and go out as you pass them, only to rekindle after
you've moved away. Almost as if alive, they turn themselves on and
off. Some creating symbolic patterns on the walls with different
patterns of light. Dim, dark, bright.. These particular fixtures of
light serve more of a purpose then decoration. Some flash
unexpectedly, creating small wisps of colored smoke. These are more
than just candles; they certainly hold some Arcane power.
18252.name: Dome Ledge

description: The rocky cavern walls make a shift in direction here, a fairly
quick one, turning the path from one way to another, without much
berth for it's wide walls to compensate. The feeling of closeness is
multiplied, as the walls would turn a larger race sideways in order to
fit  With one wall nearly at each fingertip of an extended wingspan,
it wouldn't take much to keep on track.
18235.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: The only naturally provided light in this twisted cavern, is given
by small specks of dust, somehow producing their own glow. Though as
widespread as the dust is, it does nothing in the way of lighting the
cave. All that can be seen are random flickers of light from the
fluorescent dust. All else is shrouded in blackness.
18230.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: Entering a small recess from the dome, you are covered in darkness
as no candles are present to light the alcove. Though small, it's one
part of the journey in the dome that doesn't require a careful step.
A tiny haven from the dangers outside.. It's almost peaceful. It's
unfortunate that the only way to go from here.. Is back into the
blood red lit cavern.
18241.name: Dome Alcove

description: The air in this part of the cavern is quite damp, as if it had just
rained. A near explosion of dust particles continuously flies in from
one section of the cave, filling the place with dust. Because of the
humid air, the dust is weighed down and deposited on the floor, making
it slick. The only possible ways to go, are directly into the fan of
dust, or across the slick ground  The walls to either side are close
enough to be felt without having to walk very far.
18233.name: Dark Cavern

description: The cavern walls come to a bend here; a slow, soft bend that
accommodates the width of the passage. Some glittery dust floats
around the bends in the walls, making it easy for one to get turned
around as they try to adjust to the shift in direction. The darkness
of the cavern shows no sign of retreating in any of the directions
that the walls now run.
18224.name: Cavern Corner

description: To one direction, the cavern delves into a small dark cave. To the
other; it opens up into a gigantic chasm filled with spiraling red and
green candles, starting from its murky depths and working their way up
the walls to the very top of the dome-shaped cave. Two directions are
a current possibility for travel into this dome:  North and south.
Both follow along the walls with a wide ledge protruding from the very
surface of the rock.
18250.name: Dome Entranceway

description: To one direction lies a blackness that engulfs the cave in a
complete shroud, to the other - a light. A faint blue illuminates the
ground and the walls, revealing small puddles hidden in potholes,
created from water dripping off stalactites. The bluish glow creates
long shadows stretching west.
18222.name: Bluish Cavern

description: Resulting from two tight turns; one to the north and one to the
east, this area of the ledge is narrower than the other two
directions.. Where the ledge quickly pivots inwards, toward the wall,
creating a space of only a few feet between the wall and the dangerous
edge. As ominous as the green candles are, engulfing the wall in
flame, the edge is more of a worry at this point. Between the flames
and the edge it would be hard to decide where to walk.
18245.name: Dome Ledge

description: This room is made of the finest marble and is huge. The walls glow brightly
from the light of four gigantic pillars of flame that light the room.
On the far end of the chamber is a huge door, one hundred feet wide and twice
that large. There are no keyholes of any kind. Piles of bones lay, strung
about the room.
18211.name: In a Gigantic Room made of Marble

description: There seems to be no way to continue further, as the slick,
glass-like walls come to and end. The walls, as if sealing a great
fire, burn indefinitely as the light from hundreds of torches are
reflected upon it's surface. The northern end of the wall has been
constructed in such an enchanting way that no mortal could have ever
built such a wonder. The wall is circular in shape, with a spiral of
layered rock beginning at the very top most part and swirling around
to end in the center. The fiery mural follows this pattern, seemingly
caught up in the circle..  A mass of swirling flames circling forever.
18292.name: Fiery Cavern

description: Only darkness occupies this narrow spot in the cavern. A flicker
or two of yellowish light here and there is about all that can be
seen. The distance is immeasurable in the blackness, making the width
of the cavern more of a guess than an assurance.
18234.name: Dark Cavern

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18271.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18261.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: Betraying the closeness that darkness creates, the cavern is
actually quite large, with the walls of the cave several meters apart
from each other. Though it saves one from the feeling of a tight
space, it enhances the probability of becoming lost  One can only
wander so far in once direction though, before realizing travel that
way is no longer possible. Returning to the longer path being the
only recourse.
18218.name: Dark Cavern

description: The small corrider of the cave gives way to a large cavern, very well
lit by the ever burning torches that line the walls. The stone here is less
rough and almost polished looking, however several burn marks are
still visible on the otherwise immaculate floor. The far end of the cavern
is shrouded in shadow, unlike the rest of the area, and nothing is visible
within its unknown recesses. The floor slopes gently downward and a staircase
is visible, slightly hidden in the floor.
18202.name: Huge Cavern Inside the Cave

description: Almost as if the cavern has been cleaved, a flat, purely smooth
wall is designated to the back of this open area. At the bottom of
the wall lies an opening, leading off into a pitch black nothingness.
The area here gets its faint, off-red luminescence from several
candles set horizontally and direct into the eastward traveling wall,
on both the northern and the southern sides. This glow is more
pronounced further to the east, where the tunnel opens up.
18238.name: Cavern Opening

description: The rock here is inexplicably smooth on all sides. The only coarse
surface is the ground, which allows for some traction. The rest
though, is so fine that it almost appears glossy in your light. The
cavern is perfectly rounded, creating a semi-circle shape where the
walls meet the ground. No miner or anything of the sort would have
ever of been able to do work like this.. Especially not in such
unmarred detail.
18265.name: Dark Cavern

description: A swirling mass of sparkling dust is thrown around the cavern as if
blown by an ever-changing gust of wind. It travels so quickly it's
almost as if it were a Maelstrom of powder. Ultimately it seems to be
heading in one direction, though it'd be hard to know for sure which,
especially with the swirling chaos all about.. Knowledge of a
direction would be impossible.
18232.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: {*The area you are now in is an odd sight indeed. Tendrils of{x
{*light flow in front of you, darkening and converging as the Plane{x
{*continues north. The molecules of light combine to form a half-rock{x
{*substance which solidifies as it continues north. The combination of{x
{*their molecules creates a substance more rock-like than not as it{x
{*stretches north. The choppy half rock, half light particle substance{x
{*converges into a solid ground after a few yards. The transition from{x
{*nothingness to solid rock is astounding in such a place. The newly{x
{*formed rock continues for several yards leading to a cave opening. {x
{*The cave appears to stretch on for eternity disappearing into a{x
{*darkness, darker than night itself.{x
18215.name: Astral Convergence

description: The only thing in this cave, besides you, is water.. Coating the
tunnel walls and running down in rivulets to create small puddles on
the ground, where the floor meets the wall. The water slowly drains
southward in two small streams on either side of the path. Other than
that, you are accompanied only by the darkness.
18284.name: Dark Cavern

description: All around you, it seems as if the entire cavern were on fire.
The ceiling; the walls; even the floor flicker furiously with flames
that appear to be traveling north at intense speeds. Along the bottom
and the top of the walls, hundreds of torches are placed.. On both
sides. Reflecting off the cavern's extremely glossy, reflective
surface and blown by a wind of unknown source from the south, it
creates this magnificent image of a fiery chasm. As if the flames
were somehow trapped beyond the rock.
18290.name: Fiery Cavern

description: Self-illuminating glitters of dust seem to be heavily concentrated
here, making the darkness even harder to navigate, as they create a
haze of dim light and grey flurries. The disorienting effect of the
dust and it's odd movement, set amongst the hazy glow, causes shapes
to form in it's midst, differing based upon whomever's eyes are being
clouded by it.
18219.name: Dark Cavern

description: Torches line the walls inside the cave, illuminating deep scratch marks
in the stone walls. The stone is rough and shows evidence of being recently
charred or burned. The torches continue farther into the cave and there is still
no evidence of any life in the cavern.
18201.name: Inside a Huge Cave

description: The walls in this small cavern room are brightly lit by a blue hue,
almost not a single shadow present, due to the brightness of the
light. Yet the light is hardly harsh on the eyes. It comes from a
pedestal located directly in the center of the room. The pedestal
itself is created of a blue and silver marble.  It's design is such as
one would find in a library.. One designated to carry a large book.
18220.name: House of the Arcane

description: A small over-hang of rock protrudes from the wall, above the
opening to the west. Out of the center of the overhang, pointing
east, sticks the fore half of a spear; it's head still attached. It
seemingly points towards what this magnificent dome contains - a
canyon. Just a few short yards to the east, a lip in the ground
precedes a severe drop, hundreds of feet downwards, into a dark chasm,
filled with a black liquid, turning the entire canyon below into a
lake, stretching far to the east, framed by walls on all sides. The
liquid in the lake is hardly discernible as to it's substance, being
as there's not enough light so far down. The world above the abyss is
lit quite well in comparison. It's walls filled with thousands of
candles set directly into the dome's rounded walls. The candles are
placed nearly to the top, creating a light that fills the area with a
dark reddish hue. Despite the fullness of light that the candles give
off, the only way to see very far into the cavern would be to continue
deeper into its bowels. The only way through is to go along the
current path, either north or south, along the edge of the steep
decent.. Between that and the steep wall.
18239.name: Dome Entrance

description: A very rounded turn in the cavern path creates a small bowl in the
northern part of the curve, illuminated by a dense cloud of glowing
dust. As it swirls around itself in this bowl, large quantities of it
escape into the cavern at once, replaced only with another batch,
making the entire area a blanket of haze. The wideness of the turn
allows for more room in which to get lost in the dust.
18231.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: With a personal light source being particularly worthless, made so
by the absolute darkness, it would be hard for one to notice the
sudden, sharp turn in the cavern walls. The sharp turn allows no room
for the wide cavern to be compromised in the shift, making the turn
somewhat narrower than the rest of the cave.
18225.name: Dark Cavern

description: This perilous ledge offers the looming presence of a giant circular
wall on one side, and a swift death on the other, down a long decent
into a sloshing lake of black liquid. Not enough of the liquid can be
seen to discern what it is, though.. Despite the thousands of candles
that spiral up the dome washing the area with a dark red light.
18242.name: Dome Ledge

description: In this section of the tunnel, large patches of moss cling to the
walls almost covering them entirely. A few patches of wet, bare rock
can be seen, however, along with the bald ceiling and floor.
Everything not covered in growth is instead covered in a slick wetness
that makes footing a bit of a challenge to keep, for anyone not
accustomed to walking in these conditions.
18282.name: Mossy Cavern

description: You now travel a wide ledge created right out of the rocky wall of
which this large dome is constructed. On the other side of that wall
is something equally large and steep.. Yet reversed in direction. A
drop-off more than a couple hundred feet is no more than a few yards
away. Ringing the dome are thousands of candles protruding directly
out of the cavern wall, nearly all of them burning. In a few spots
closest to you a random green candle is set amongst all the deeper red
ones.
18249.name: Dome Ledge

description: In this section, the moss on the walls is so thick that it seems to
reflect your light turning the cave into a well-lit area. It's growth
consumes the entire surface of the walls and even a portion of the
ceiling. The only are that remains untouched is the very top of the
ceiling, and the damp floor. Many wisps of green almost algae-like
substance hang off of the walls and the ceiling.. Some reaching
nearly to the ground.
18274.name: Mossy Cavern

description: All around you, covering the entire area of the walls and the
ceiling is a thick, heavy mossy substance, growing right out of the
rock. Even the ground has a few spots of growth dotting it. The
cavernous moss appears to grow more sophisticated to the east; one of
the directions this corner of the tunnel turns to. Even here amongst
the fuzzy green an occasional bud can be seen.
18275.name: Mossy Cavern

description: The tightness of the cavern grows as it gets deeper inside itself.
By standard means it's not small, yet more than one average size human
would have a bit of trouble walking shoulder to shoulder with another.
Though, due to the small size of this area, navigating in the darkness
isn't much of a difficulty, as there's always a wall close by to
follow at either side, not leaving any room to get turned around.
18227.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: A prevalent cloud of dust lingers in the air here, drifting about
lazily, yet seemingly, at a slow pace, pushing northwards. A small
amount of light from the south catches on the haze making a small
amount of light possible in the tight cavern  The walls stretch to
the south and the east. Off to the east, the light is non-existant.
18229.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: This room is very plain; merely a simple oval shaped room with rock
on all sides. The only variation to the small cave is the southern
wall, which has been inlaid with several layers of a circling
formation of rock, starting at the very bottom point and ending in the
center. This cavern appears to have no ceiling.. Instead it shoots
off upwards into the darkness seemingly forever. There doesn't look
to be a way up the shaft.. Though the walls might be rocky enough to
provide ample foot holds.
18293.name: Bottom of the Shaft

description: This part of the ledge is more of an offshoot from the main dome,
sticking out several yards by itself, held up only by it's own
structure.  Both sides of the path drop off steeply into a lake of
blackness, hardly lit by the hundreds of candles set into the rock,
covering the rocky slide down. These candles, like the others filling
the dome, crackle with energy, weaving arcanist runes.
18255.name: Dome Ledge

description: The light of the torches reveals an immaculate, almost polished finish
to the stone. For the first time signs of life are evident, as you see
pieces of furniture and jewelry strung about the floor, amongst other plunder.
18203.name: In a Huge Subterranean Cavern

description: The winding halls of this cavern create a narrow space in which to
walk, only compounded by the inability to see the walls. Watching
one's step would be sound advice here, as it would be dangerous to
tromp through the blackness while facing a possibly ever-changing
direction.
18226.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: This dark cavern continues into seemingly nothingness to both the
western and the southern directions, not revealing much even in the
face of your light. Moisture covering the walls and the ceiling keep
the air damp and cool, even somewhat refreshing.
18287.name: Dark Cavern

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18263.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: On the side opposite the blackness-filled canyon, a perfect circles
of candles burns a bright green, all around creating a smoke-less ring
of fire. These candles, like all the others, do not drip any wax.
The heat from the green flames billows outwards as if the candles
actually held a larger flame than they do. Also more pronounced than
it should be, is the light they give off.. Looking directly into it
would render any normal man blind for a good period of time.
18247.name: Dome Ledge

description: You are several feet from the bottom of the circular shaft. Either
way you might be heading; up or down, it's a perilous journey. The
fall would mean severe injury accompanied, perhaps, by death. Even
from this height.
18294.name: Steep Shaft

description: The tunnel here is quite windy here, making it impossible to see
further than the nearest turn. The only ways to go from here are to
the west and the north, both of which turn to another direction not
far along. The moist air keeps the atmosphere somewhat chilly, and
your person damp.
18286.name: Dark Cavern

description: As a continuously shifting cavern, the walls here hold to no true
direction, constantly making turns and stops, no matter which way one
was to travel. Thanks to the total darkness, it would be impossible
to tell when or where the turns will end.. No sign of a designated
path or area for which the cavern can follow.
18236.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: This part of the ledge widens considerably as the edge nearest the
water extends outwards, away from the wall. Instead of detaching
itself it remains a part of the dome's walls becoming merely an
extension. This could only be viewed as an overall improvement in
structure. The many candles that ring the dome are placed closer to
the ground here, nearly coming in contact with the ledge at some
points. These candles, nearest the ground glow an odd color of green
instead of the dark red that so many others burn. Some of the green
ones even appear to be lit amongst the red.. Construed into shapes.
18243.name: Dome Ledge

description: The Mad Hatter is having a party today and all his wonderland
friends have come to enjoy tea and cakes.  Oh look to the far table:
it's the Sergeant.  Oh no Mr.  Sergeant, don't drink the flower
arrangement water!  Doesn't chivalry also take into account manners?
Tsk tsk.  Oh and the Dragon Queen herself has graced us with her
presence!  Oh wise and generous Queen, your humble servant shall pour
you a cup of tea *curtsey*.  My my, you have so many friends--there is
hardly any room at all at the table with all your dragons and their
big tales and disregard for manners!  Cover your mouth dear Blue
Dragon.  Cake crumbs are getting EVERYWHERE!  Oh I so would like a
scone, White Dragon if you will be so kind...
18214.name: The {yTea {BRoom{x

description: This part of the cavern has been hollowed out into a large
oval-shaped dome. At either side, near the very top, are two holes
from which a yellow light pours in to illuminate the sides of the
cavern in an eerie sort of way. Also filtering in through the holes
is a fine glitter of dust, reflecting the light about the cavern as it
settles in the wide open space. The dust fills the room and drifts
off lazily to the north, where that wall of the oval opens into more
of the cave, a much smaller space than the one in which you currently
reside. The south, however, is dust free, as if something prevents it
from going that way.
18228.name: Oval Cavern

description: A fairly tall, yet thin rock rock formation.. Shaped a bit like a
dolphin's dorsal fin.. Splits this area of the cavern right down the
middle. Though the area is more than large enough to accommodate the
presence, for any large group of adventurers, it would cause a
temporary cleft in the formation.
18288.name: Dark Cavern

description: The walls of the cave immediately split off to either side of the
entrance, traveling off into the darkness. The cave, while more solid
than the atmosphere surrounding it, hasn't lost some of the other
attributes of mystique. Dust particles float about lazily, often
catching a bit of light from the odd strands outside, while others
produce their own, flickering on and off. Despite this, though, the
cavern stays dark, offering no solace to those with weak eyes.
18216.name: T-Cross

description: The walls here are so extremely smooth that their surface has a
reflective quality about it. With enough light, you would be able to
see yourself in it. Apart from your own light, however, the only
source of illumination comes from the east.. A bright orange glow
penetrates the darkness from that direction. It only lights up this
area so far in before darkening again.
18289.name: Dark Cavern

description: Here, four torches adorn the wall, allowing the climb upwards to be
seen clearly. Not more than a dozen feet above you is a large
landing, on which it seems this shaft comes to an end. The other end
lay below your feet, no telling how far, into the deep cold darkness..
Lit only by a small amount of light down that way.
18298.name: Steep Shaft

description: Only a small amount of bare rock can be seen amongst the
over-growth of wild plant life. Everything, save the floor and the
highest part of the ceiling, is covered in a damp moss, which produces
a dew, covering all the rock with a slick wetness. The cavern makes a
turn here as well - to the north and to the west - almost at a nintey
degree angle.
18281.name: Mossy Cavern

description: There's isn't much room to move around in this small cave; three
walls surround you leaving only one opening to the west, which leads
to what appears to be a large room. A deep red glow coming from that
direction partially gives light to where you are now. The only thing
aside from rock, is a large hole in the ground near the farthest wall.
Other than the opening to the west, it appears to be the only way out
of this small room.
18257.name: Dark Cavern

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18258.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: The wide patio-like structure that you stand on, remains fully
connected to the large dome surrounding it. Turning in direction
slightly here the path gets narrow, making the skirt around the giant
lake in the middle at bit more caution demanding. The candles on the
rounded walls are a bit more sparse here than can be seen in the
deeper parts of the area, and less active as well.
18256.name: Dome Ledge

description: This entire passage is absolutely covered in a thick blanket of
moss, growing straight out of the rock and stretching its way over the
walls and up the ceiling. Budding flowers and long snakes of algae
can be found amongst the moss. The floor itself is lightly covered in
growth.. Mainly moss, with a touch of grass.
18280.name: Mossy Cavern

description: Despite being such a large cavern, the pressing darkness makes the
immediate space seem much smaller than it actually is.  Or..
Perhaps.. Much larger. Not knowing where one wall or the other lay,
makes traversing the cavern slightly disorienting. The easiest way
for one with only the aid of a simple light, would be to find one wall
and follow it in the desired direction.
18217.name: Dark Cavern

description: This part of the dome's balcony turns off from the wall, creating
an open space on either side of the walkway. The same candles on the
wall light the way downwards as well, deep into this newly created
chasm. These are more active than the ones on the taller cavern walls
as not a single one is unlit, and more than a few are crackling and
creating sparks of magic within their runes.
18253.name: Dome Ledge

description: Standing here is almost like being in the midst of an inferno
without the heat. All around you, set upon the rock as if trapped
behind it's glossy surface, flames rush northward as if blown from the
mouth of a great dragon. The torches which produce the spectacle
flicker almost rhythmically with each other as the southern wind blows
them about. This flickering causes the walls of flames to jump and
swirl about the walls.
18291.name: Fiery Cavern

description: Covered, floor to ceiling, with moss and plant life, this part of
the cavern is so dense with living foliage that the air itself is damp
from the water produced by the plants. Many different types of
flowers and small stalks litter the ground and the walls, while
whip-like vines hang down from the ceiling.
18279.name: Mossy Cavern

description: This small tunnel only offers two paths to take.. North into a
maze of random cavern exits.. And south into the darkness. The
darkness to the south is impossible to see past, so discerning what
lies to the south would only be possible by searching that area.
18266.name: Short Tunnel

description: At this point in the shaft, neither the bottom or the top can be
seen, as both are shrouded in darkness. Not knowing the distance you
have yet to travel, it would be wise to not get careless.
18295.name: Steep Shaft

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18260.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: Solid rocks on all sides but one greet you as you enter. A rounded
wall to the south blocks any further progress down this tunnel. All
you can possibly is turn back north to the rest of the tunnel, and
search the maze of openings again.
18270.name: Dead End

description: Set far apart from the actual dome, you stand on a long chunk of
rocky walkway. To the north is an extreme drop into the same liquid
that fills the rest of the chamber. Not nearly as big as the other
lake, yet more than perilous if one were to get too close to the edge.
The candles lining the way down flicker and crackle with mystic
energy, creating runes of smoke in the dark hole. As if they were
casting spells..
18254.name: Dome Ledge

description: Long stalactites hang from the ceiling here, a few slowly dripping
water to the floor. The erosion from perhaps centuries of water
droplets has created deep potholes in the ground.. Not very large
around, but more than likely several feet deep. The ground is smooth
and slick for the very same reason.
18285.name: Dark Cavern

description: Here, the cave turns into a Northwest corner that shifts the path
around. Down the cave in both possible directions is nothing more
than continuous walls of damp rock, dripping into puddles on the
ground. The only change noticeable so far is the amount of foliage..
Which appears to increase to the south.
18267.name: Dark Cavern

description: West and east are the only directions in which to continue through
this short, yet wide cavern tunnel. The walls are damp and slick,
cultivating moss in a few places. Small puddles of water are strewn
about the ground most likely created as a runoff from the moisture on
the walls.
18268.name: Dark Cavern

description: A huge tunnel made of the finest polished marble is illuminated by the
torches. The tunnel is oversized in all respects, as if made for something
gigantically larger than a human. A few fine scratch marks line the floor
but other than that the corridor is bare.
18204.name: Huge Marble Tunnel

description: As the corridor continues, you begin to see the entrance to a huge chamber
far ahead of you. Torches line the walls up until the exit to this gigantic
room. Light is pouring out of the exit to the room, illuminating the tunnel.
18209.name: Approaching a Huge Chamber

description: The darkness is so intense in this part of the cavern that even the
brightest light would simply be constricted to it's own source. The
floor of the cavern is slightly damp, with a solitary puddle in a few
spots. None very large, though, mostly just gathered water in pivots
on the ground. Where the water itself comes from would be hard to
discern in the darkness.
18223.name: Dark Cavern

description: Nothing can be seen, either up or down. Whether you're ascending
or descending, there is no way of telling how far you have yet to go.
The rock on the walls provides more than good footing and grip for
your hands, though.. No matter how big they may be.
18296.name: Steep Shaft

description: Foliage is abundant in this area of the cave, mossy patches stuck
on the walls while strands of a plant-like substance hang down from
the ceiling. The ground is the only part untouched by the growth;
save for a few spots on the walls that haven't been covered yet. The
ceiling is nearly the same as the floor, the tendrils just giving it
more of a habited look than it should.
18273.name: Dark Cavern

description: The walls in this part of the area have been partially spotted with
patches of a mossy substance, somehow created directly from the
moisture that covers the rocky walls of the cavern. Fairly sparse,
though, is the amount of actual moss.. It's growth doesn't seem to be
too well supported by the hard walls.
18283.name: Dark Cavern

description: This is a gigantic room, all around you finely polished black marble gleams.
Huge pillars of flame rise from the ground on all sides of a gigantic
platinum throne. The throne is large enough to sit an abnormally large
dragon. A huge door made of pure steel covers the east wall.
18212.name: Throne Room of Tchazzar

description: You are at a wide turn in the cavern.. One wide enough for a large
party of people to wander. The turn creates a large gap in the cave,
making it more of a separate room than just another part of the path.
Though with two walls on either side, framing the darkness, the exits
are unmistakably only available in two directions.
18237.name: Dark, Twisting Cavern

description: This part of the ledge is nearly stranded from the rest of the
dome. Sticking out quite a ways, and mostly detached from the wall,
it's only held up by itself and it's two anchors to the east and the
south, where it connects back to the main dome. This creates a death
trap on either side, with two plummets awaiting any careless enough to
wander to close. The only dangerous part of this dome that you
currently done face, are the fiery candles lining the walls.
18248.name: Dome Ledge

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18262.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: The cave here widens considerably into a circular area. The
foliage is at it's densest here, over-grown with many different types
of living species of plants. Even an occasional bush, or small tree
can bee seen. The plants look more alive than ever, some moving of
their own accord. A few may even be deadly, due to their bright
colors and menacing movements.
18278.name: Cavern Jungle

description: This large room is unlit by the numerous torches outsie in the marble
hall. It is obviously meant to be a recess for a guard to stand in
impeding passage farther town the marble corridor. This room however is
extremely large, able to accomidate several guards, or something larger.
18208.name: In a Huge Side Chamber

description: This huge room is filled with treasures beyond imagination. Piles of gold
and jewels line the floors, piled meters high. Everything seems to
shine brightly, gold and metal alike.
18213.name: Vault of Tchazzar

description: Flowers, pods, grass, moss, and several other different types of
plants populate the area you are now in. The entirety of the walls
and the ceiling are covered with moss. The more complicated species
of plants are sparse but still quite populous. The ground beneath
your feet is covered lightly with moss on which a short layer of grass
grows.
18276.name: Mossy Cavern

description: The moss here grows so dense, it's almost like walking through a
jungle. Despite the wideness of the cavern, if it could be called a
cavern anymore, it seems small when filled with all the plant life.
Large flowers bloom frequently along the way east. Not only flowers,
but other plants as well, giving the place a very lively feeling
indeed.
18277.name: Mossy Cavern

description: You find yourself in the middle of several tunnels leading in every
direction. Most appear to either curve one way or another just beyond
their openings. While the darkness is stifling, a proper light helps
plenty.
18259.name: Tunnel Cluster

description: In this semi-round "chamber" of sorts, water runs freely from the
north, streaming southward towards the cavern wall, in small rivets,
to disappear into the ground. The water's source is two waterfalls to
the north, spilling out of the ceiling on the far wall. Not large
waterfalls, but producing enough water to create steady streams.
These waterfalls frame a tall steel door, from behind which a blue
glow is emitted, filling the cavern with a pleasant blue light,
bouncing off the water's trickle, casting a blue and silver glow about
the walls. Directly in front of the door stands a small gnome,
dressed in full battle gear; cleaver at the ready.
18221.name: Gnome's Door

description: Slip!
18244.name: Slick.~

F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M grall 18254 100~

description:
This man is a powerful warrior, a member of the dreaded Serpent Guard.
He is adorned in dark, black steel armor engraved with the symbol of a
five-headed dragon.
18200.room_name: {*A strong Knight of the Serpent Guard stands here.{x
18200.name: {*a Knight of the Serpent Guard{x~

description:
This powerful dark paladin is adorned in black steel platemail engraved
with skulls and dragons. On the center of his breastplate is a
symbol of a five-thorned rose.
18201.room_name: {8A powerful Knight of the Five Thorned Rose stands here.{7
18201.name: {8a Knight of the Five Thorned Rose{7~

description:
This man is a powerful paladin of dark powers. He is adorned in dark
black steel platemail and seems to be of the rank of Sergeant
in his Knighthood.
18202.room_name: {8A Sergeant in the Knighthood of the Five Thorned rose stands here.{7
18202.name: {8a Sergeant of the Five Thorned Rose{7~
18202.keywords: paladin knight sergeant five thorned rose~

and it snarls loudly

He holds in his hand the most beautiful sword you've ever seen.

description:
Dressed in a complete suit of battle armor, this short gnome stands guard by a steel
door, hefting a large meat cleaver as a forewarning about the meaning of his presence
by the sealed portal. His armor is black.. every piece of it down to the steel-plated
boots. This contrasts his yellowish colored skin and dark red eyes.
18221.room_name: An armor-clad gnome stands rigid by a tall door.
18221.name: The Gnome~
